DataElement.preferredName: Study Site Equal Study Site MIBG Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response to whether the enrolling site also acts as the MIBG site.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Study Site Equal Study Site MIBG
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted._The quality of being the same in quantity or measure or value or status._A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted._A synthetic, aralkylguanidine analogue of the adrenergic neurotransmitter norepinephrine (NE) and adrenergic neuron blocking agent with potential diagnostic imaging or antineoplastic activity when radiolabeled. Iobenguane, also known as metaiodobenzylguanidine (MIBG), is taken up and accumulates in the granules of adrenal medullary chromaffin cells and in the pre-synaptic granules of adrenergic neurons in a manner almost identical with that of NE. In radiolabeled forms, iobenguane may be used to image or eradicate neuroendocrine tissues and tumor cells.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted.

Property.preferredDefinition: The quality of being the same in quantity or measure or value or status.:A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted.:A synthetic, aralkylguanidine analogue of the adrenergic neurotransmitter norepinephrine (NE) and adrenergic neuron blocking agent with potential diagnostic imaging or antineoplastic activity when radiolabeled. Iobenguane, also known as metaiodobenzylguanidine (MIBG), is taken up and accumulates in the granules of adrenal medullary chromaffin cells and in the pre-synaptic granules of adrenergic neurons in a manner almost identical with that of NE. In radiolabeled forms, iobenguane may be used to image or eradicate neuroendocrine tissues and tumor cells.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being the same in quantity or measure or value or status.
A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted.

A synthetic, aralkylguanidine analogue of the adrenergic neurotransmitter norepinephrine (NE) and adrenergic neuron blocking agent with potential diagnostic imaging or antineoplastic activity when radiolabeled. Iobenguane, also known as metaiodobenzylguanidine (MIBG), is taken up and accumulates in the granules of adrenal medullary chromaffin cells and in the pre-synaptic granules of adrenergic neurons in a manner almost identical with that of NE. In radiolabeled forms, iobenguane may be used to image or eradicate neuroendocrine tissues and tumor cells.
